Rodger Barros Antunes Campos

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/6682179634478803
  • Última atualização do currículo em 11/09/2019

Doutor em Economia pela Faculdade de Economia e Administração da Universidade de São Paulo. Possui graduação em Ciências Econômicas pela Universidade Presbiteriana Mackenzie (2011) e mestrado em Economia pela Universidade Federal de Juiz de Fora. Foi pesquisador visitante no Regional Economics Applications Laboratory (REAL) da University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (UIUC), Estados Unidos, durante o primeiro semestre de 2017. Atualmente é professor titular I do Ibmec SP, economista sênior no GrupoZap, pesquisador associado do Núcleo de Economia Regional e Urbana da Universidade de São Paulo (NEREUS), consultor ad hoc da FIPE e revisor de revistas acadêmicas nacionais e internacionais. Tem experiência na área de Economia, com ênfase em Métodos Quantitativos, atuando nos seguintes temas: Economia Regional e Urbana, Avaliação de Política Pública, Econometria Espacial e Microeconometria e publicações em revistas acadêmicas nacionais e internacionais. As questões unificadoras dos trabalhos em desenvolvimento são: mercado imobiliário, renda e uso do solo, habitação popular, mercado de trabalho, economia de aglomeração, construção civil e desenvolvimento econômico. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Projetos de pesquisa
2016 - Atual
A New Empirical Methodology for Subcenter Business District Identification
Descrição: Theoretical models concerned with multiple centers was brought to the debate on sprawling urban employment. However, empirical methods that identify central places are not a specific aspect in the specialized literature. Many of these methods demand from researchers a minimum knowledge of the city or region under analysis. Thus, the main objective in this project is to propose an empirical methodology that takes into account labor market data only, overcoming the need for prior knowledge of researchers. The new proposed empirical methodology will be tested, considering labor market data from the both following regions: Metropolitan Area of São Paulo and Municipality of São Paulo..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Rodger Barros Antunes Campos - Coordenador.
2016 - Atual
Earmarking unconstitutionality and its impact on housing deficit: Evidence from São Paulo State, Brazil
Descrição: Earmarking taxes is a common policy mechanism in Brazil. The Brazilian Federal Constitution of 1988 earmarks a large part of tax revenue to expenditures considered essential, such as education, public health and social security. Focus on Sao Paulo state housing policy, earmarking mechanism was used to face housing deficit. Historically, housing policy has been developed by state government with own financial resource and rules. The funding to finance the program stemmed from state government fiscal power and public spending decision in social areas. Regarding to fiscal power, the state government enacted the State Law 6.556 of November 1989, which expanded the taxation on goods and service circulation (from 17% to 18%), earmarking the incremental revenue to low-income housing policies. However, the Brazilian Federal Constitution (FC) of 1988 forbids earmarking tax revenues to an agency or fund, or to expenses not related to public health or education (Braz. Const. art. 167, §4 (1988)). For this reason, in September 18th, 1997, the Brazilian Supreme Federal Court declared the State Law 6.556 of Sao Paulo was against the FC, alleging that the latter do not consider housing programs in its art. 167 §4 as a possibility of earmarking tax revenues, nor allow the destination of the revenue to an agency as CEF and CDHU. This project aims to evaluate the impact on Sao Paulo state housing deficit after Brazilian Supreme Federal Court decision about state government earmarking unconstitutionality. Results from this research contributes to the debate on earmarking and sheds light on housing deficit dependence on state government commitment..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Rodger Barros Antunes Campos - Coordenador / Gustavo Pereira Serra - Integrante.
